title: Mobile-Backend Authentication Integration
description:
Complete mobile authentication system integrating Flutter app with FastAPI backend.

## Goals
1. Mobile-specific API endpoints (`/api/v1/mobile/auth/*`) with optimized responses
2. Secure token storage using platform keychains (iOS Keychain, Android Keystore)
3. Native Telegram OAuth via deep link flow
4. Dual biometric options: App lock and full biometric login
5. Offline-capable sessions with cached data access

## Implementation Phases
- Phase 1: Foundation (email/password auth) - 4-5 days
- Phase 2: Token Management (session handling) - 2-3 days
- Phase 3: Telegram OAuth (native auth) - 3-4 days
- Phase 4: Biometric Authentication - 3 days
- Phase 5: Offline Mode & Polish - 2-3 days

## Success Criteria
- Login Response Time < 500ms p95
- Registration Completion Rate >= 85%
- Token Refresh Success Rate >= 99.5%
- Biometric Auth Adoption >= 60%
- Telegram OAuth Conversion >= 75%
- Offline Session Recovery >= 95%

Source: .beads/docs/prd-mobile-auth-integration.md

title: Phase 1.1: Create Mobile Auth API Endpoints
description:
Create FastAPI mobile-specific authentication endpoints.

## Endpoints to Implement
- POST `/api/v1/mobile/auth/register` - Register new user with device info
- POST `/api/v1/mobile/auth/login` - Login with email/password
- POST `/api/v1/mobile/auth/refresh` - Refresh tokens
- POST `/api/v1/mobile/auth/logout` - Logout and revoke tokens
- GET `/api/v1/mobile/auth/me` - Get current user profile
- POST `/api/v1/mobile/auth/device` - Register/update device

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All endpoints return proper JSON responses per PRD schemas
- [ ] Device registration captures: device_id, platform_id, platform, os_version, app_version, device_model
- [ ] Rate limiting: 5 attempts/min for login, 3 attempts/min for register
- [ ] Error codes match PRD specification (INVALID_CREDENTIALS, EMAIL_EXISTS, etc.)
- [ ] Access token TTL: 15 minutes
- [ ] Refresh token TTL: 7 days (standard), 30 days (remember_me)
- [ ] Unit tests cover all endpoints

## Technical Notes
- Use existing auth infrastructure from backend-api-service.md
- Mobile endpoints under `/api/v1/mobile/auth/*` prefix
- Return mobile-optimized responses (include subscription info in login)

## Quality Gates
- [ ] Backend tests pass
- [ ] API endpoints respond correctly with test requests

title: Phase 2.3: Implement Request Queue for Concurrent 401s
description:
Implement request queue to handle concurrent 401 responses.

## Implementation Details
- Queue requests while token refresh is in progress
- Retry all queued requests after successful refresh
- Fail all queued requests if refresh fails

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Multiple concurrent 401s trigger only ONE refresh call
- [ ] All 401 requests queued during refresh
- [ ] After successful refresh: retry all queued requests with new token
- [ ] After failed refresh: reject all queued requests
- [ ] No race conditions or memory leaks
- [ ] Integration tests with concurrent requests

## Technical Notes
- Use `Completer<Response>` for queued requests
- Track `_isRefreshing` boolean state

## Quality Gates

title: Phase 3.1: Create TelegramOAuthService with Deep Links
description:
Implement Telegram OAuth service with native deep link handling.

## Implementation Details
File: `lib/features/auth/data/services/telegram_oauth_service.dart`

## Flow
1. User taps "Sign in with Telegram"
2. Open Telegram app via deep link: `tg://resolve?domain=CyberVPNBot&start=auth_timestamp`
3. User approves in Telegram
4. Telegram redirects back via `cybervpn://telegram-auth?tg_auth_result=...`
5. App captures callback and sends to backend

- [ ] Listen for callback via `app_links` package
- [ ] Parse `tg_auth_result` from callback URI
- [ ] Handle Telegram app not installed (show message + app store link)
- [ ] Cleanup stream subscription on dispose
- [ ] Unit tests for deep link parsing

## Packages
- `url_launcher` for opening Telegram
- `app_links` for receiving callbacks
